intro: Bonellia moana, commonly known as the marine worm or sea rag, is a species of polychaete annelid found in tropical and subtropical marine environments. It belongs to the family Bonelliidae and is characterized by its elongated, segmented body. The plant, though not a true plant, exhibits some botanical-like features due to its colonial growth patterns and specialized structures. It thrives in shallow coastal waters and plays a role in marine ecosystems by contributing to sediment stabilization. Its morphology includes a distinct anterior and posterior region with different morphological adaptations.
